author: sproul
content:
<@388610194608750595> How is the mev-boost relay currently getting the withdrawals for payloads? Looking at your Prysm fork it looks like you've added gRPC endpoints for getting payload attributes (although I don't see withdrawals)?

I'm looking at adding a push-based publishing of payload attributes to Lighthouse, with a CLI flag to enable publishing on every slot as well as each fcU. Would this be useful for builders and relays prior to Capella on mainnet? I've described a bit more of my thinking here: <https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/issues/244#issuecomment-1439293791>

author: metachris_
content:
We've also implemented the `/eth/v1/beacon/states/{state_id}/withdrawals` endpoint to our Prysm fork: https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/issues/301 

Code: https://github.com/flashbots/prysm/commit/0f0c6082b06303615c4a4c5a95e40f19268cc03f + https://github.com/flashbots/prysm/commit/bfeb9a575235c9a63b1d46486654748d051aa221

Fwiw, I think it would be great to have the SSE stream event you proposed in the issue!

author: sproul
content: Oh cool, I think <@607055410104500244> implemented something similar for Lighthouse. We can probably have both

author: jgm
content: I'm more inclined to go the route of https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/issues/244 rather than have what will no doubt be more and more endpoints as we add fields to the consensus node.  Adding fields to the event seems more reasonable, although in that case we may want a `version` field in there as well to know which hard fork we're dealing with.

author: sproul
content:
Good idea with the version

I think having both in this case is not so bad, especially as computing withdrawals from states is independently interesting (although arguably redundant when they are available post-inclusion in blocks)
